definitions.definition: An acute , sometimes recurrent febrile disease caused by infection of a hemolytic streptococcus , associated with intense edematous local inflammation of the skin and subcutaneous tissues , and marked by large raised red patches on the skin.

main_definition: ( pathology ) An acute , sometimes recurrent febrile disease caused by infection of a hemolytic streptococcus , associated with intense edematous local inflammation of the skin and subcutaneous tissues , and marked by large raised red patches on the skin.
